titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the William Lofland Dudley Papers

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

repository.corpname: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

chronitem.event: Demonstrator of Chemistry, Miami Medical College of Cincinnati.
Professor of Chemistry and Toxicology, Miami Medical College
Honorary Degree Doctor of Medicine from Miami Medical College.
Chair of Chemistry at Vanderbilt University.
Director of Affairs of Tennessee Centennial Exposition
Secretary of section of Inorganic Chemistry at International Congress of Arts and Sciences in St. Louis.
Recieved patent for flooring which he designed -- magnesia-cement composition containing cellulose water-proofed with paraffin and asbestos.
Investigation of influence of coal gas on corrosion of wrought-iron pipe laid under Nashville streets.

Organized Southern Intercollegiate Athletic
Association, president for 18 years.
Member of Executive Committee of the National
Intercollegiate Athletic Association.
Organizer and President of University Club of Nashville.
Unmarried.
Reprint from Journal of Industrial and Engineering Chemistry, Vol. 6, No. 10, page 856.

did.unittitle: Correspondence - Outgoing. Thirty Letters Arranged Chronologically
Correspondence - Incoming. 386 Letters Arranged Alphabetically, 286 Typed, 100 Holograph.
Lecture Notes - Holograph. 40 items. Arranged Alphabetically by Title.
Holograph Notes on Various Subjects. Untitled.
Chemical Analyses. Holograph. One Analysis of stomach contents of W.L. Dudley, among others.
Roll. One Roll Bool and One List. Roo Book Entitled "Classes in Chemistry in the Miami Medical College."
Printed Lists and Notes. Concerns such things as paper topics, Dudley's original research, iron and steel companies, the electron theory.
Printed Articles and Speeches - 4 items. One untitled. Other Three are: "Determination of Silver by Sodium Carbonate"; "Intercollegiate Athletics in the South"; "Our Sister Schools."
Invitation. Fourteen. One photograph of David Dudley Miller, age two years.
Membership Certificates. Acknowleding Dudley's membership in various clubs and organizations. Six.
Business Reports - Bills, receipts, accounts, one application for patent of spark arrester.
Articles and Reprints by Dudley. Alphabetically Arranged.
Papers Relating to Athletics. Lists of players, Certificate of Eligibility, etc.
Athletics - Business Papers. S.I.A.A. Committee Minutes, Rule Changes, article on "Summer Baseball vs the Amatuer Clause."
Chemical Laboratory - Blueprints and Business papers; Blueprints of Chemical department at Cornell University; Dudley's file on this material marked "to be destroyed."

Documents, Ordinances - Five. Preamble and Constition of S.I.A.A.; Ordinance for Nashville Subway; Ordinance for Nashville Telephone Co.; Charter of Incorporation for Nashville Telephone Co.; Report on a Purposed Suburban Electric Railway.
Constitution and By-Laws, handbooks, and Game rules.

Eighth International Congress of Applied Chemistry. Printed Memoradum; Preliminary Announcement; 14 copies of "List of Topics Proposed for Section XI, a, for Eighth International Congress of Applied Chemistry."
Speech. "Provincialism and the Citizenship of Tennessee" by Edward H. Barthell.

Articles and Reprints by Others. F. W. Clarke, "The Constitution of the Tarrates of Antimony"; Waller Deering, "The Anglosaxon Poets on the Judgement Day"; Ernest Victor Jones, "Tellurium, A Spectographic Study"-2 Copies
News Bulletins and Specail Report. 13 copies of N.C.A.A. News Bulletin; Specail Report of the Executive Committee of the Alumni Association of Vanderbilt University.
Memorials - "William Lofland Dudley" by Charles Baskerville; "Lucius S. Merriam" by J. H. Hollander and others; "Gates Phillips Thruston, Jr."; "Hiram A. Vance".

Bulletins - Cincinnati Section, American Chemical Society; History of the Miami Medical College and of its Faculty and Alumni; Alumni Catalogue Miami Medical College; Petition of the Establishment of a Joint Chapter of Sigma XI at Vanderbilt University and George Peabody College for Teachers; Vanderbilt University Quarterly, Vol. XIV, No. 4.
Book. Ohio Mechanics Institute, Historical Sketch
A 1934 map of Vanderbilt, was separated from this collection, whereabouts now unknown.
Acme White Lead and Color Works (A. M. Woodward) (1)
Blakiston, P., Son & Co. (H. G. White) (1)

did.unittitle: There are twenty-four letters covering a period from 1899 to 1912.
All can be found in folder one.
